meanings.definition: The quality of being easily digested.
meanings.sent1: The digestibility of this soup makes it a great choice for people with sensitive stomachs.
meanings.sent2: Nutritionists often consider the digestibility of different foods when creating meal plans.
meanings.sent3: I wish my homework had the digestibility of a short story instead of a novel.
meanings.sent4: The digestibility of the information in the presentation was so clear that everyone understood it easily.
meanings.sent5: The digestibility of the new software made it a favorite among users for its simplicity.

meanings.definition: The extent to which food can be broken down and absorbed by the body.
meanings.sent1: The digestibility of the vitamins in fruits is important for our health.
meanings.sent2: Doctors often discuss the digestibility of certain nutrients with their patients.
meanings.sent3: The digestibility of the cake was so good that I couldn't resist having a second slice.
meanings.sent4: The digestibility of knowledge is crucial for students to absorb information effectively.
meanings.sent5: The digestibility of the new medication allowed patients to recover quickly from their illnesses.
